freetext: Corrected for detection efficiency, resonance self-
shielding, multiple scattering.
Correction for finite sample effects less than 15%
above 5 keV.
The overall uncertainty in the shape of the
cross sections is obtained from the following
energy-dependent components:
* statistical and systematic uncertainties in the
gamma-ray counts and neutron flux data (including
contributions from backgrounds);
* an estimated 20% uncertainty in the correction
applied at high energies for the effect of the
variation of the gamma-ray pulse-height distribution
with neutron energy;
* and estimated uncertainties in the corrections
applied for multiple scattering and resonance
self-shielding.
The major uncertainties in the normalization
of the capture cross sections are:
* the uncertainty (typically < 5%) in the absolute
capture probability determined from the areas of
resolved resonances;
* a 5% uncertainty from systematic errors in the flux
measurements;
* and an uncertainty (~ 5%) in the gamma-ray yield
at the matching region 2-8 keV due to a 20%
uncertainty in the determination of background
caused by neutrons scattered from the sample.
Time-of-flight. 230 m flight path.
Below 80 keV.
Above 80 keV.
Enriched samples in oxide form.
